name: ABCD Study Protocol
description:
Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) Study imaging protocol.

The ABCD study tracks brain development of over 10,000 children (ages 9-10 at baseline) through adolescence across 21 sites in the United States. The imaging protocol was harmonized across three 3T scanner platforms: Siemens Prisma, GE 750, and Philips.

Reference: Casey et al. (2018) "The Adolescent Brain Cognitive Development (ABCD) study: Imaging acquisition across 21 sites." Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience 32:43-54.

ABCD_fMRI_DistortionMap_PA.description: fMRI B0 field map - Posterior-Anterior phase encoding
ABCD_fMRI_DistortionMap_PA.detailed_description:
## fMRI Distortion Correction - PA Direction

Spin-echo EPI field map for geometric distortion correction of functional MRI data. Acquired with posterior-to-anterior (PA) phase encoding direction.

ABCD_fMRI_task_MID.detailed_description:
## Monetary Incentive Delay Task (MID)

Task-based fMRI measuring reward processing, including anticipation and receipt of monetary rewards and losses. Robust activator of the ventral striatum.

### Cognitive Domains (from Table 1)
- **Reward Processing**: Anticipation and outcome of reward and loss
- **Motivation**: Anticipation of responding for outcome

### Neural Correlates
- Ventral striatum
- Orbitofrontal cortex
- Medial prefrontal cortex
- Ventromedial prefrontal cortex

### Task Design
- 2 runs, 50 trials each (100 total)
- Trial types: Win $5, Win $0.20, Lose $5, Lose $0.20, $0 neutral
- Adaptive algorithm maintains ~60% hit rate
- Average earnings: $21

### Key Parameters
- Same as resting-state fMRI (2.4mm, TR=800ms, MB=6)
- Duration: 5:42 per run

### References
- Knutson et al. (2000) NeuroImage

Localizer.detailed_description:
## Localizer

Standard localizer acquisition using 32-channel head coil for planning subsequent scan prescriptions. Acquired in orthogonal orientations (ROW and COL phase encoding) for optimal slice positioning.

### Key Parameters (Siemens)
- Sequence: 2D Gradient Echo
- Resolution: 0.49 × 0.49 mm in-plane
- Slice Thickness: 7 mm
- TR/TE: 7.5/3.69 ms
- Flip Angle: 20°

ABCD_T2w_SPC_vNav.description: 3D T2-weighted SPACE/CUBE with vNav motion correction
ABCD_T2w_SPC_vNav.detailed_description:
## 3D T2-Weighted Structural Imaging (SPACE/CUBE)

High-resolution T2-weighted fast spin echo with variable flip angle (SPACE on Siemens, CUBE on GE) for detection and quantification of white matter lesions and CSF. Uses volumetric navigators for prospective motion correction.

### Clinical Purpose
- White matter hyperintensity detection
- CSF quantification
- Lesion characterization
- Complementary contrast to T1w

### Key Parameters (from Table 2)
| Platform | Matrix | Resolution | TR | TE | Flip | Time |
|----------|--------|------------|-----|-----|------|------|
| Siemens | 256×256 | 1.0 mm iso | 3200 ms | 565 ms | Variable | 6:35 |
| Philips | 256×256 | 1.0 mm iso | 2500 ms | 251.6 ms | 90° | 2:53 |
| GE | 256×256 | 1.0 mm iso | 3200 ms | 60 ms | Variable | 5:50 |

### Technical Notes
- Parallel imaging: 2× 
- Variable refocusing flip angle train for optimal contrast
- 176-256 slices depending on platform

ABCD_T1w_MPR_vNav.description: 3D T1-weighted MPRAGE with vNav motion correction
ABCD_T1w_MPR_vNav.detailed_description:
## 3D T1-Weighted Structural Imaging (MPRAGE)

High-resolution T1-weighted magnetization-prepared rapid acquisition gradient echo (MPRAGE) scan for cortical and subcortical segmentation. Uses volumetric navigators (vNav) for prospective motion correction and selective reacquisition.

### Clinical Purpose
- Cortical surface reconstruction
- Subcortical volume segmentation
- Gray/white matter differentiation
- Anatomical reference for functional data

### Key Parameters (from Table 2)
| Platform | Matrix | Resolution | TR | TE | TI | Flip | Time |
|----------|--------|------------|-----|-----|------|------|------|
| Siemens | 256×256 | 1.0 mm iso | 2500 ms | 2.88 ms | 1060 ms | 8° | 7:12 |
| Philips | 256×256 | 1.0 mm iso | 6.31 ms | 2.9 ms | 1060 ms | 8° | 5:38 |
| GE | 256×256 | 1.0 mm iso | 2500 ms | 2 ms | 1060 ms | 8° | 6:09 |

### Technical Notes
- Parallel imaging: 2× (GRAPPA/SENSE/ARC)
- Prospective motion correction via vNav (Siemens, Philips) or PROMO (GE)
- 176-208 slices depending on platform

ABCD_dMRI.description: High angular resolution diffusion imaging (HARDI) with multi-shell acquisition
ABCD_dMRI.detailed_description:
## Diffusion-Weighted Imaging (HARDI)

High angular resolution diffusion imaging (HARDI) with multiple b-values for white matter tract segmentation and diffusion measurement. Includes fast integrated B0 distortion correction using reversed polarity gradient (RPG) method.

### Clinical Purpose
- White matter tract segmentation
- Fractional anisotropy (FA) mapping
- Mean diffusivity (MD) measurement
- Tractography and connectomics

### Key Parameters (from Table 2)
| Platform | Matrix | Resolution | TR | TE | Flip | Directions | b-values | Time |
|----------|--------|------------|-----|-----|------|------------|----------|------|
| Siemens | 140×140 | 1.7 mm iso | 4100 ms | 88 ms | 90° | 96 | 500(6), 1000(15), 2000(15), 3000(60) | 7:31 |
| Philips | 140×140 | 1.7 mm iso | 5300 ms | 89 ms | 78° | 96 | 500(6), 1000(15), 2000(15), 3000(60) | 9:14 |
| GE | 140×140 | 1.7 mm iso | 4100 ms | 81.9 ms | 77° | 96 | 500(6), 1000(15), 2000(15), 3000(60) | 7:30 |

### Technical Notes
- Multiband acceleration: 3×
- Partial Fourier: 6/8 (Siemens/GE) or 0.6 (Philips)
- 81 slices
- Multi-shell scheme enables advanced diffusion models (NODDI, etc.)

ABCD_dMRI_DistortionMap_AP.description: Diffusion B0 field map - Anterior-Posterior phase encoding
ABCD_dMRI_DistortionMap_AP.detailed_description:
## dMRI Distortion Correction - AP Direction

Reversed polarity gradient field map for EPI distortion correction of diffusion data. Acquired with anterior-to-posterior (AP) phase encoding direction, paired with PA acquisition for topup/FSL distortion correction.

ABCD_dMRI_DistortionMap_PA.description: Diffusion B0 field map - Posterior-Anterior phase encoding
ABCD_dMRI_DistortionMap_PA.detailed_description:
## dMRI Distortion Correction - PA Direction

Reversed polarity gradient field map for EPI distortion correction of diffusion data. Acquired with posterior-to-anterior (PA) phase encoding direction, paired with AP acquisition for topup/FSL distortion correction.

ABCD_fMRI_DistortionMap_AP.description: fMRI B0 field map - Anterior-Posterior phase encoding
ABCD_fMRI_DistortionMap_AP.detailed_description:
## fMRI Distortion Correction - AP Direction

Spin-echo EPI field map for geometric distortion correction of functional MRI data. Acquired with anterior-to-posterior (AP) phase encoding direction.

ABCD_fMRI_rest.detailed_description:
## Resting-State Functional MRI

High spatial and temporal resolution simultaneous multi-slice (SMS)/multiband EPI resting-state fMRI for examining functional connectivity. Participants passively view a crosshair with eyes open.

### Protocol
- 4 runs of 5 minutes each (20 minutes total)
- 2 runs acquired after T1w
- 2 runs acquired after T2w
- Eyes open, passive fixation crosshair viewing

### Key Parameters (from Table 2)
| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| Matrix | 90 × 90 |
| Resolution | 2.4 mm isotropic |
| TR | 800 ms |
| TE | 30 ms |
| Flip Angle | 52° |
| Slices | 60 |
| Multiband Factor | 6 |

### Technical Notes
- High temporal resolution (TR=800ms) enabled by multiband
- Mean frame-to-frame displacement: 0.22 mm (SD=0.20)
- FIRMM real-time motion monitoring at Siemens sites

ABCD_fMRI_task_EN-back.detailed_description:
## Emotional N-back Task (EN-back)

Task-based fMRI measuring working memory and emotion regulation. Variant of the HCP n-back task with emotional face stimuli.

### Cognitive Domains (from Table 1)
- **Memory**: Working memory (2-back vs 0-back), encoding, retrieval
- **Emotion Regulation**: Reactivity to fearful/happy vs neutral faces

### Neural Correlates
- Dorsolateral prefrontal cortex
- Parietal cortex
- Premotor cortex
- Hippocampus/parahippocampus
- Amygdala
- Ventral striatum

### Task Design
- 2 runs, 8 blocks each
- Block types: 2-back (high load) and 0-back (low load)
- Stimulus types: Happy faces, fearful faces, neutral faces, places
- 160 trials total (40 per stimulus type)
- NimStim + RADIATE face stimulus sets

### Key Parameters
- Same as resting-state fMRI (2.4mm, TR=800ms, MB=6)

### References
- Barch et al. (2013) - HCP task design
- Cohen et al. (2016)

ABCD_fMRI_task_SST.detailed_description:
## Stop Signal Task (SST)

Task-based fMRI measuring impulsivity and impulse control. Participants respond to arrow direction but must inhibit response when stop signal appears.

### Cognitive Domains (from Table 1)
- **Impulsivity**: Error monitoring (failed stops)
- **Impulse Control**: Conflict monitoring and resolution (correct stops)

### Neural Correlates
- Dorsal striatum
- Anterior cingulate cortex
- Ventrolateral prefrontal cortex

### Task Design
- 2 runs, 180 trials each (360 total)
- 150 Go trials + 30 Stop trials per run
- Tracking algorithm maintains ~50% stop success rate
- Stop Signal Delay (SSD) adapts based on performance

### Key Measures
- Stop Signal Reaction Time (SSRT)
- Go trial reaction time
- Stop accuracy

### Key Parameters
- Same as resting-state fMRI (2.4mm, TR=800ms, MB=6)
- Duration: 349s per run

### References
- Logan (1994)
- Whelan et al. (2012) Nature Neuroscience
